page.title: 07MEMORIES and CHANGE (1)
page.content:
Some of the older, retired people who have lived and worked in Thorner over a long period of time were asked about changes which they had seen during the 20th Century.
They said that new innovations and ideas had only been accepted slowly.
Farmers had supplied most produce for the village, there was little need to go out of Thorner to shops. Until the 1960's there had been a railway, but a regular bus service from the Beehive public house had taken over. Some remembered horse drawn transport in the village...until 1962 a horse called Prince regularly pulled a malt cart in Thorner.
